title: Pete Anderson, Veteran Music Sales Executive, Dies at¬†72
summary: During his long career, Anderson worked for the distribution company of CBS Records/Sony Music, among other posts.
body: Pete Anderson , a veteran sales executive with a long history in the music industry, passed away after a stroke on Sunday (Dec. 11) in St. David, Pa. He was 72. During his music industry career, Anderson worked for the distribution company of CBS Records/Sony Music, Epic Records, Atlantic Records and wholesaler Valley Media. He finished his career at Gotham Distributing/Collectables Records after marrying record label executive Melissa Greene of that company‚Äôs founding family. Related Music Executives & Other Behind-the-Scenes Players We Lost in 2025 Maya J'an Signs With Warner Records: Debut Single is a Powerful 'Love Letter' to Hometown After L.A. Fires Kennedy Center President to 'Seek $1 Million in Damages' From Jazz Musician Who Called Off Christmas Eve Show While many label/distribution sales executives were known to play hardball or use economic incentives to accomplish goals for their records, Anderson was known for being honorable, respected, and, in the words of former Trans World Entertainment buyer Vinnie Birbiglia , a ‚Äúpleasure to deal with.‚Äù Born in Muskegon, Mich., Anderson‚Äôs early life and early career saw him anchored in the Midwe‚Ä¶

title: Trannie Anderson Talks Revealing More of Her Heart on ‚ÄòHeart Like a Songwriter‚Äô & Picking ‚ÄòSongs That Introduce Who I¬†Am‚Äô
summary: Grammy nominee Trannie Anderson is set to release her songwriting project and make her Grand Ole Opry debut.
body: Songwriter Trannie Anderson was driving to go deer hunting when she found out she‚Äôd landed her first Grammy nomination, earning a nod for best country song for Lainey Wilson‚Äôs ‚ÄúSomewhere Over Laredo,‚Äù which Wilson wrote with Anderson, Andy Albert and Dallas Wilson. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt really have any [cell] reception,‚Äù Anderson recalls to Billboard . ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt even get the live stream to work. Lainey texted us and I legitimately had to pull over to the side of the road and I was just sobbing. It was very special. It was bigger than I dreamed‚Äîand I got a deer that weekend, too, so it was pretty much the best weekend, ever.‚Äù Anderson has co-written nearly a dozen songs that have populated Lainey‚Äôs two CMA album of the year-winners Bell Bottom Country and Whirlwind , including the Country Airplay No. 1 ‚ÄúSomewhere Over Laredo‚Äù and top 5 hits ‚ÄúHeart Like a Truck,‚Äù and ‚ÄúWildflowers and Wild Horses.‚Äù Cole Swindell, Gabby Barrett, Madeline Edwards and Nate Smith have also recorded her songs. Anderson highlights a wider scope of her songwriting range on her full-fledged songwriter project, Heart Like a Songwriter , out Friday (Jan. 16). Heart Like a Songwriter blends poems and music, including And‚Ä¶

title: ‚ÄòHeated Rivalry‚Äô Won‚Äôt Generate Any Heat at This Year‚Äôs Primetime Emmys. Here‚Äôs¬†Why.
summary: Darn rules.
body: Heated Rivalry is one of the most buzzed-about TV miniseries in recent years, a true phenomenon that has crossed over beyond what anyone might have thought possible for a gay love story. Related ‘Heated Rivalry’ Is Getting an Official Soundtrack ‚Äî and It’s Coming Sooner Than You Think ‘Heated Rivalry’ Synchs Lead to Big Gains for Feist, Wolf Parade, Wet Leg & More Indie Favorites How ‚ÄòHeated Rivalry‚Äô Episode 4‚Äôs Viral ‚ÄòAll the Things She Said‚Äô Needle Drop Came Together: ‚ÄòInstead of Tripping Out at the Club, You‚Äôre Lusting Out‚Äô So, it‚Äôs natural to start thinking about the show‚Äôs Primetime Emmy potential. Let‚Äôs see, there could be acting nominations chatter about Hudson Williams (who plays Canadian Shane Hollander) and Connor Storie (who plays Russian Ilya Rozanov). And there could be nods in music categories for the show‚Äôs lead composer Peter Peter and/or the many artists who contributed songs to the miniseries. We might as well call a halt to all this conjecture right here, because the program won‚Äôt be eligible for the Primetime Emmys. A spokesperson for the Television Academy chose to deliver the good news first: ‚Äú Heated Rivalry &‚Ä¶

title: Billboard‚Äôs Music Industry Events¬†Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. title: Clouds Swimming over Lago Argentino
summary: A collection of fish-shaped clouds hovered above the glacial lake in Patagonia in December 2025.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Clouds Swimming over Lago‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us Search December 27, 2025 When an astronaut aboard the International Space Station snapped this photograph of Lago Argentino in Patagonia on December 27, 2025, a school of fish-shaped clouds lingered over the glacial lake‚Äôs teal waters. Determining the clouds‚Äô type and origin from the photograph alone is challenging, but several NASA scientists and university researchers offered a theory after reviewing the image. ‚ÄúThe lens shape reminds me of lenticular clouds , which usually form near or over mountains,‚Äù said Maria Hakuba, a research scientist in the aerosols and clouds group at NASA‚Äôs Jet Propulsion Laboratory. ‚ÄúThe edges of the cloud also look quite smooth rather than ‚Äòfuzzy,‚Äô which suggests they‚Äôre ice‚Ä¶
